clinical_study.brief_title: Nexavar Post-marketing Surveillance for RCC in Japan: Early Access Program
clinical_study.official_title: Special Drug Use Investigation of Nexavar (Unresectable or Advanced Renal Cell Carcinoma: Early Access Program)

brief_summary.textblock: This study is an early access program of 'Nexavar post-marketing surveillance (PMS) for renal cell carcinoma (RCC) in Japan' which is a regulatory, local prospective and observational study for patients with unresectable or advanced RCC under real-life practice conditions. The objective of this study is to assess safety and effectiveness of Nexavar at some limited sites which joined to clinical trial of Nexavar, before available of it in the market. The enrollment period is 2 months, and patients who received Nexavar will be recruited and followed one year since starting Nexavar administration. The data of this study will be integrated into the Nexavar PMS and the data will not be analyzed and reported alone.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of adverse drug reactions and serious adverse events in subjects who received Nexavar
primary_outcome.time_frame: After Nexavar administration, up to 1 year

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of adverse drug reactions in subpopulation in a variety of baseline data [such as demographic data, concomitant disease, clinical staging of RCC, Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group-Performance Status (ECOG-PS)]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After Nexavar administration, up to 1 year

secondary_outcome.measure: Effectiveness evaluation assessment [overall survival, response rate, stable disease rate, progression disease rate] by investigator-determined overall best response [according to the General rule for clinical and pathological studies on RCC]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After Nexavar administration, up to 1 year

secondary_outcome.measure: The status of therapy with Nexavar [duration of treatment, daily dose]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After Nexavar administration, up to 1 year

intervention.description: Patients who have received Nexavar for unresectable or advanced RCC.

study_pop.textblock: The target population of this study is patients who received Nexavar for unresectable or advanced RCC.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who received Nexavar for unresectable or advanced renal cell carcinoma
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who are contraindicated based on the product label
